column1: Consumer Price Index (CPI) statistics, alternative measures, unadjusted and seasonally adjusted, Bank of Canada 1
Consumer Price Index (CPI) excluding food, energy and the effect of indirect taxes
Consumer Price Index (CPI) excluding food, energy and the effect of indirect taxes, seasonally adjusted
Consumer Price Index (CPI) inversely weighted by volatility and is adjusted to exclude the effect of changes in indirect taxes (CPIW) (year-over-year percent change)

column2: not available for a specific reference period

The Bank of Canada is no longer publishing the Consumer Price Index (CPI) excluding 8 of the most volatile components and indirect taxes (CPIX) (index, 1992=100). This information is available in archived CANSIM table 326-0001, core Consumer Price Index (CPI) (Bank of Canada definition).
